availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Bath County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Virginia native. Married to Mary Swetman. Father of Elizabeth A. Swetman, M. A. Swetman, John J. Y. Swetman, William W. Swetman, Ann E. Swetman, Mary M. Swetman, Charlotte J. Swetman, Nancy L. Swetman, and Sarah F Swetman. Appointed Lieutenant Colonel of the 65th Regiment of Kentucky Militia in 1839. Farmer in Bath County in 1850.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, p. 77B
Find A Grave, "Jos T. Swetman (1800-1886)," Memorial #68470094, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/68470094 (accessed October 21, 2019).
